com.sonomatech.csvdict

Class CSVDict

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sonomatech.csvdict.CSVDict
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntKeyCSVDict

    public class CSVDict
extends Object
    Turns a CSV file into an in-memory table that is queried using a key value and a position. The key value selects the row in the table and the position selects the column. A header row in the CSV file containing field names is required

    • Constructor Detail

      • CSVDict

        public CSVDict(String csvfn,
       char delimiter,
       int keyIndex,
       ClassLoader cl)
        throws CSVDict.CSVDictException
        The constructor reads the CSV file into a LinkedHashMap of string arrays.
        Parameters:
        csvfn - the name of the CSV file
        delimiter - the column delimiter in the CSV file
        keyIndex - the zero-based index of the column that is to be used as the key
        cl - the CSV file must be on this class loader's classpath
        Throws:
        CSVDict.CSVDictException

      • CSVDict

        public CSVDict(String csvfp,
       char delimiter,
       int keyIndex)
        throws CSVDict.CSVDictException
        The constructor reads the CSV file into a LinkedHashMap of string arrays.
        Parameters:
        csvfp - full path to the csv file
        delimiter - the column delimiter in the CSV file
        keyIndex - the zero-based index of the column that is to be used as the key
        Throws:
        CSVDict.CSVDictException

      • CSVDict

        public CSVDict(BufferedReader br,
       char delimiter,
       int keyIndex)
        throws CSVDict.CSVDictException
        The constructor reads the CSV file into a LinkedHashMap of string arrays.
        Parameters:
        br - an initialized buffered reader of the CSV file
        delimiter - the column delimiter in the CSV file
        keyIndex - the zero-based index of the column that is to be used as the key
        Throws:
        CSVDict.CSVDictException

    • Method Detail

      • getString

        public String getString(String key,
               int pos)
                 throws CSVDict.CSVDictException
        This method is for accessing the value as a String
        Parameters:
        key - the value of the key field that selects the row
        pos - the zero-based position in the row of the desired value
        Returns:
        the selected cell in the CSV file as a String, or null if cell is empty
        Throws:
        CSVDict.CSVDictException - if no row is found that matches key value or pos is greater than number of columns

      • getFloat

        public Float getFloat(String key,
             int pos)
               throws CSVDict.CSVDictException
        This method is for accessing the value as a Float.
        Parameters:
        key - the value of the key field that selects the row
        pos - the zero-based position in the row of the desired value
        Returns:
        the selected cell in the CSV file as a Float, or null if cell is empty
        Throws:
        CSVDict.CSVDictException - if no row is found that matches key value or pos is greater than number of columns or val cannot be interpreted as a float

      • getInteger

        public Integer getInteger(String key,
                 int pos)
                   throws CSVDict.CSVDictException
        This method is for accessing the value as an int.
        Parameters:
        key - the value of the key field that selects the row
        pos - the position in the row of the desired value
        Returns:
        the selected cell in the CSV file as an int, or null if selected cell is empty
        Throws:
        CSVDict.CSVDictException - if no row is found that matches key value or pos is greater than number of columnsor val cannot be interpreted as an int

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount()
        Returns:
        the number of rows in the CSV file not including the header row

      • getFieldNames

        public String[] getFieldNames()
        Returns:
        the field names form the header row in the CSV file

        Gets the specified column from the CSV file
        Parameters:
        colPos - zero-based column number
        Returns:
        the values of the specified column as a String array

      • getColumn

        public String[] getColumn(String fieldName)
        Gets the specified column from the CSV file
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the field name in the header row specifying the column to get
        Returns:
        the values of the specified column as a String array

      • getFilteredColumn

        public String[] getFilteredColumn(String fieldName,
                         String filterColumn,
                         String filterValue)
        Gets the specified column from the CSV file, and filters the list based on whether or not the row contains the filterValue in the filterColumn. An example would be, select all values in column fieldName where values in Column filterColumn == filterValue.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the field name in the header row specifying the column to get
        filterColumn - the field name in the header row specifying the column which contains the filterValue
        filterValue - the value in the column, columnWithFilterValues, on which to filter
        Returns:
        the values of the specified column as a String array

      • getFilteredColumn

        public String[] getFilteredColumn(int colPos,
                         int filterColPos,
                         String filterValue)
        Gets the specified column from the CSV file, filtered for rows which contain the filterValue in the filterCol. See getFilteredColumn with String arguments for an example.
        Parameters:
        colPos - zero-based column number
        filterColPos - zero-based column number
        filterValue - the value in the column, filterColPos, on which to filter
        Returns:
        the values of the specified column as a String array

      • getColPos

        public int getColPos(String fieldName)
        Gets the col number of the given field
        Parameters:
        fieldName -
        Returns:
        the position of the column
